abstracts.cdata!:
The Transport Infrastructure Maintenance
            and Rural Access Project development objective is to upgrade
            the country's transport infrastructure to a condition
            that facilitates the transportation of freight and
            passengers, at a cost-efficient level of service. The first
            component - Transport infrastructure rehabilitation -
            entails reinforcement, replacement, and rehabilitation
            works, subdivided into three subcomponents: A) route
            management by the Direccion Nacional de Vialidad (DNV) or
            the National Highways Directorate; B) management of roads
            and bridges by the National Road Corporation - CVU; and, C)
            rehabilitation of the transfer terminal rehabilitation.
            Component 2 - Road rehabilitation and maintenance
            contracting - CREMA contracts - and contingencies, will
            implement the rehabilitation and maintenance works in six
            road sub-networks covering an estimated 981 km of national
            roads through performance-based CREMA contracts. Component 3
            - Departmental road rehabilitation and maintenance, and
            contingencies, includes selected annual departmental road
            rehabilitation and maintenance sub-projects. The fourth
            component - Transport infrastructure safety program - aims
            at implementing low-cost measures and investments to
            increase road safety, and, the fifth component - Transport
            sector management and institutional building will provide
            technical assistance to enhance transport infrastructure management.
